<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.4 <U>Amendments to the Security Agreement.</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<B>Excluded Assets &#151; Aircraft Related Equipment</B>. Clauses (i)&nbsp;and (ii)&nbsp;of the definition of
Excluded Assets are hereby amended and restated in their entirety as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) any aircraft, airframes, aircraft engines or propellers and parts and appliances
attached thereto, all spare parts and appliances relating to any aircraft, airframes,
aircraft engines or propellers, any rights of any Obligor as lessee, licensee, lessor or
licensor with respect to a lease or license of any of the foregoing any other assets
customarily securing Indebtedness used to acquire, finance or refinance such assets such as
all books, records, logs, manuals, data and inspection, modification and overhaul records,
related Intellectual Property (whether owned or leased) and, in the case of spare parts,
spare part tracking systems and any and all computer programs and inventory management
systems (including but not limited to all source codes and user interfaces associated
therewith as well as all date files used as input thereto and data files or other records
generated thereby) used to track and manage the location, use, and maintenance status of
spare parts and appliances and related purchase agreements and warranty rights and the like,
and all assets of the type specified in Sections&nbsp;2.1(a) through (j)&nbsp;of the Aircraft
Mortgage, in each case whether now owned or hereafter acquired, including all Airframes,
Engines, Propellers and Spare Parts (each as defined in the Aircraft Mortgage);
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) any Slots, Gates, Routes and Supporting Route Facilities (each as defined in the
Loan Agreement)&#096; now held or owned or hereafter acquired by any of the Grantors;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<B>Excluded Assets &#151; Flight Simulators</B>. Clause (vii)&nbsp;of the definition of Excluded Assets
is hereby amended and restated as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii) any Flight Simulator (other than any Flight Simulator described on part (a)&nbsp;of
Schedule&nbsp;I hereto and any other Flight Simulator specifically
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">identified and subjected to the Lien hereof pursuant to a supplement hereto) and, all replacements and substitutions
therefor and any other assets customarily securing Indebtedness used to acquire, finance or
refinance Flight Simulators, such as all records, logs and other documents and the like at
any time maintained with respect to the foregoing, all purchase agreements and warranty
rights with respect to any of the foregoing, all Intellectual Property embedded in or used
primarily with respect thereto, all rents, issues, profits, revenues and other income
therefrom, and all proceeds thereof.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;<B>Excluded Assets &#151; Leased Property</B>. Clause (viii)&nbsp;of the definition of Excluded Assets is
hereby amended by inserting the following immediately after the word &#147;material&#148; at the end thereof:
&#147;and any fixtures and improvements located on the leased premises&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;<B>Excluded Assets &#151; Liens</B>. The definition of Excluded Assets is hereby amended by deleting
the words &#147;on the Closing Date&#148; in clause (ix)&nbsp;thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;<B>Excluded Assets &#151; Tempe Property, CFCs, Aircraft Purchase Agreements, Aircraft Related
Equipment, Property Subject to Specified Transactions, Proceeds</B>. (i)&nbsp;clause (xi)&nbsp;of the definition
of Excluded Assets is hereby amended by deleting the word &#147;and&#148; at the end thereof; (ii)&nbsp;clause
(xii)&nbsp;of the definition of Excluded Assets is hereby amended by replacing the period at the end
thereof with a semicolon; and (iii)&nbsp;the following new clauses (xiii)&nbsp;through (xviii)&nbsp;are added to
the definition of Excluded Assets:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xiii) the Tempe Property and any Investments permitted under Section&nbsp;6.2(xiii) of
the Loan Agreement;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xiv) 35% of the Voting Stock of Subsidiaries of the Grantors that are CFCs;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xv) aircraft purchase agreements, engine purchase agreements, Flight Simulator
purchase agreements and, to the extent entered into after the Closing Date, other
agreements for the purchase of Aircraft Related Equipment, in each case which by their
terms are not assignable;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xvi) all property described in clause (ii)&nbsp;of the definition of Excluded Property
that is acquired after the Closing Date (other than Ground Service Equipment, it being
understood that Ground Service Equipment shall be included in Pledged Equipment and
shall constitute Collateral whether now owned or hereafter acquired);
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>




<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xvii) from and after the consummation of a Specified Transaction, all property
sold, transferred, disposed of or pledged or financed in connection with such Specified
Transaction (and all subsequently acquired property of the same type) regardless of
whether such property remains subject to such Specified Transaction; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xviii) Proceeds of the foregoing.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;<B>Flight Simulator. </B>The definition of Flight Simulator is hereby amended and restated in
its entirety as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<u>Flight Simulators</u>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the Loan Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.5 <u>Amendments to the Aircraft Mortgage.</u>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;<B>Grant of Security Interest. </B>The proviso immediately following the first sentence of
Section&nbsp;2.1 is hereby amended by inserting immediately following &#147;Section&nbsp;2.1,&#148; the first time such
section reference appears: &#147;(A)&nbsp;from and after the Third Amendment Effective Date, and without
limiting the definition of Engines or the provisions of Section&nbsp;3.5(a) to (e)&nbsp;hereof, Collateral
shall not include any estate, right, title or interest of (x)&nbsp;US Airways (but, except as provided
in clause (y)&nbsp;and (z)&nbsp;below, shall continue to include the right, title and interest of each other
Grantor) in Spare Parts, Released Engines identified as being owned on Schedule&nbsp;V hereto by US
Airways (or formerly owned by America West Airlines, LLC) or any Contract Rights, Records,
insurance proceeds, condemnation proceeds or monies or securities related thereto, (y)&nbsp;PSA in
Released Engines identified as being owned on Schedule&nbsp;V hereto by PSA or any Contract Rights,
Records, insurance proceeds, condemnation proceeds or monies or securities related thereto and (z)
America West Airlines, LLC (formerly known as America West Airlines Inc.), if any, in Spare Parts
and or Released Engines formerly owned by it and currently owned by US Airways or any Contract
Rights, Records, insurance proceeds, condemnation proceeds or monies or securities, if any, related
thereto and (B)&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;<B>Appendix&nbsp;A &#151; Released Engines. </B>The following new definitions are hereby added to
Appendix&nbsp;A in proper alphabetical order:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<U>Released Engines</U>&#148; means the engines listed on Schedule&nbsp;V hereto.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;<B>Schedule&nbsp;V</B>. Schedule&nbsp;V is to be added to the Aircraft Mortgage in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;C
hereto.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><B>ARTICLE III</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U><B>LENDER CONSENT</B></U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Lender executing a Lender Consent Letter and providing it to the Administrative Agent
hereby consents to and authorizes (a)&nbsp;this Amendment and the amendments to the Loan Agreement
contained herein, including the terms, conditions, and forms of the exhibits hereto, (b)&nbsp;the
amendments to the Security Agreement and Aircraft Mortgage contained herein, including the terms,
conditions and forms of the exhibits and schedules thereto, (c)&nbsp;the Administrative Agent to release
any Liens on assets not constituting Collateral or any assets sold, transferred, disposed of,
pledged or financed in any Specified Transaction, including after giving effect to this Amendment,
and to execute and file such documents, instruments and agreements (including releases under the
Aircraft Mortgage) necessary or desirable to effectuate such release and (d)&nbsp;the Administrative
Agent to execute and perform an intercreditor agreement on terms not inconsistent with those set
forth in Exhibit&nbsp;B hereto.
</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>ARTICLE IV</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U><B>REPRESENTATION AND WARRANTIES</B></U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;4.1 <U>Representations and Warranties</U>. The Borrower represents and warrants to each of the parties
to the Loan Agreement that (a)&nbsp;the execution and delivery by the Borrower of this Amendment have
been duly authorized by the Borrower and, when executed and delivered, this Amendment will
constitute the valid, legally binding and (subject to general equitable principles, insolvency,
liquidation, reorganization and other laws of general application relating to creditors&#146; rights or
claims or the concepts of materiality, reasonableness, good faith and fair dealing) enforceable
obligation of the Borrower, (b)&nbsp;no Default or Event of Default has occurred and is continuing on
the date hereof and (c)&nbsp;all written information that has been or will hereafter be made available
to the Administrative Agent, any Lender or any potential Lender by or on behalf of the Borrower,
its subsidiaries, any of its affiliates or any of their respective representatives in connection
with this Amendment in respect of the Borrower, its subsidiaries and its affiliates is and will be,
when taken as a whole and in light of the circumstances under which such information was provided,
complete and correct in all material respects at the time provided and does not and will not, when
taken as a whole and in light of the circumstances under which such information was provided, at
the time provided, contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact
necessary in order to make the statements contained therein not misleading in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were or are made; provided that with respect to projected
financial information contained in any such document or furnished to any party hereto by or on
behalf of the Borrower, the Borrower represents only that such information was prepared in good
faith based upon assumptions believed to be reasonable at the time, it being recognized that such
projections as to future events are not to be viewed as facts and that actual results during the
period or periods covered thereby may differ from the projected results.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><B>ARTICLE V</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U><B>EFFECTIVENESS</B></U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;5.1 <U>Effectiveness</U>. This Amendment shall become effective upon the satisfaction of all of the
following conditions precedent (the date of satisfaction of such conditions being referred to
herein as the &#147;<U>Effective Date</U>&#148;):
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The Administrative Agent shall have received a counterpart signature page of this
Amendment duly executed by each of the Obligors.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The Requisite Lenders shall have consented to this Amendment, by executing a Lender
Consent Letter.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;The Primary Specified Transaction shall be consummated on the Effective Date immediately
following the effectiveness of this Amendment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;The Administrative Agent shall have received (i)&nbsp;reimbursement of its reasonable,
out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with this Amendment, (ii)&nbsp;for the account of each
Lender that provides a Lender Consent Letter on or before midnight New York time on October&nbsp;17,
2008, an amendment fee equal to 1.5% of such Lender&#146;s outstanding Loans as at 9:00 a.m. New York
time on the Effective Date (and prior to any prepayment of Loans made on such date), (iii)&nbsp;for the
account of each Lender that provides a Lender Consent Letter after midnight New York time on
October&nbsp;17, 2008 and before 5:00 p.m. on October&nbsp;20, 2008, an amendment fee equal to 0.75% of such
Lender&#146;s outstanding Loans as at 9:00 a.m. New York time on the Effective Date (and prior to any
prepayment of Loans made on such date) and (iv)&nbsp;all other fees payable by the Borrower pursuant to
the Fee Letter, dated as of October&nbsp;2, 2008, between Citigroup Global Markets Inc. and the
Borrower.
</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>ARTICLE VI</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U><B>MISCELLANEOUS</B></U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;6.1 <U>Miscellaneous</U>. The Loan Agreement, the Security Agreement, the Aircraft Mortgage the SGR
Security Agreement and all other Loan Documents shall remain unchanged (except as provided in
Article&nbsp;II hereof) and in full force and effect. No amendments to the Security Agreement affect the
liens granted or purported to be granted or required to be granted under the Aircraft Mortgage, the
SGR Security Agreement or the Leasehold Mortgage, Security Agreement, Assignment of Rents and
Leases and Fixture Filing (Pennsylvania) dated as of March&nbsp;21, 2007 among US Airways, Inc. and the
Administrative Agent. This Amendment may be executed in any number of counterparts, all of which
taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument, and any of the parties hereto may
execute this Amendment by signing
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">any such counterpart. This Amendment shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the
law of the State of New York. Each reference to the Loan Agreement, the Security Agreement and the
Aircraft Mortgage in the Loan Documents shall be deemed to be a reference to the Loan Agreement,
Security Agreement or Aircraft Mortgage (as applicable) as amended hereby.
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#091;Remainder of page intentionally left blank&#093;

</DIV>

delivered as of the day and year first above written.
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;A</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><U>FORM OF LENDER CONSENT</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">CONSENT

</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dated as of October &#95;&#95;&#95;, 2008

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reference is hereby made to the $1,600,000,000 Loan Agreement dated as of March&nbsp;23, 2007 (as
amended, modified and supplemented and in effect from time to time, the &#147;<U>Loan Agreement</U>&#148;),
by and among US Airways Group, Inc., as borrower, its subsidiaries from time to time party thereto,
the several lenders from time to time party therto and Citicorp North America, Inc., as
administrative agent and collateral agent (the &#147;<U>Agent</U>&#148;) for the Lenders. Capitalized terms
used but not defined herein have the meaning given to such terms in the Loan Agreement (as amended
by the Amendment).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The undersigned, as a Lender under the Loan Agreement, hereby (a)&nbsp;consents to an Amendment to
Loan Agreement, Security Agreement and Aircraft Mortgage substantially in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;A
hereto (the &#147;<U>Amendment</U>&#148;) and consents to the execution, delivery and performance by the
Agent, on behalf of the Lender, of the Amendment, (b)&nbsp;authorizes the Agent to release any Liens on
assets not constituting Collateral or any assets sold, transferred, disposed of, pledged or
financed in any Specified Transaction, including after giving effect to the Amendment, and to
execute and file such documents, instruments and agreements (including releases under the Aircraft
Mortgage) necessary or desirable to effectuate such release or as more fully provided in Article
III of the Amendment and (c)&nbsp;the Agent to execute, deliver and perform an intercreditor agreement
on terms not inconsistent with those set forth in Exhibit&nbsp;B of the Amendment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This consent shall terminate and be of no further force or effect if the Effective Date of the
Amendment does not occur on or before November&nbsp;14, 2008.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Print Name of Institution: <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>
</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="16%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="63%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD valign="top" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="left">By<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U><BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Title:<BR>
&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR>
    <TD align="left">&nbsp;</TD>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="35%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">EXHIBIT A TO CONSENT
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">&#091;see attached&#093;
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;B</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><U>EXHIBIT K</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">TERMS OF LIEN SUBORDINATION

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the Lenders will have exclusive rights to exercise, and a block on the ability of the lenders
under the second lien facility (the &#147;Junior Lienholders&#148;) to exercise lien-related rights and
remedies until after the expiration of a standstill period of 180&nbsp;days and thereafter so long
as the Lenders have commenced the exercise of remedies;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the Junior Lienholders will not object to the amount, enforceability or priority of the
Lenders&#146; claims or liens and will acknowledge that the Lenders&#146; senior obligations for
purposes of the intercreditor agreement will include post petition interest, whether or not
allowed;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the Junior Lienholders will not object to (or support others in objecting to) a
&#147;debtor-in-possession&#148; financing or use of cash collateral;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(iv)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the Junior Lienholders will not object to the Lenders&#146; adequate protection, nor will the
Junior Lienholders seek adequate protection in the form of cash payments without the consent
of the Lenders; provided that, Junior Lienholders shall be entitled to obtain replacement
liens on the Collateral if the Lender&#146;s first obtain a replacement lien on such Collateral so
long as the Junior Lienholders&#146; lien is subordinate to the Lender&#146;s lien on at least the same
terms hereof;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(v)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the Junior Lienholders will not object, and will be deemed to have consented to (including
for purposes of Section 363(f) of the Bankruptcy Code), any sale or disposition of the
Collateral under the Loan Documentation consented to by the Lenders whether in a consensual
sale or disposition, upon enforcement of rights outside of bankruptcy, in any bankruptcy
proceeding or otherwise, and the Junior Lienholders will be deemed to have released their
liens on such assets (but shall retain their lien on the sale proceeds thereof subject to all
rights of the Lenders to such proceeds);</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">(vi)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Junior Lienholders shall retain the same rights as any unsecured creditor;
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(vii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the Lenders and the Junior Lienholders shall have separate grants of security and vote as
separate classes on any plan of reorganization in connection with any bankruptcy proceeding;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(viii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the documentation with respect to the second lien facility will not be amended in certain
respects without the consent of the Lenders; and</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ix)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>No provisions inconsistent with the terms of this Exhibit shall be included in any
documentation related to the Junior Lienholders&#146; facilities.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<TYPE>EX-10.78
<SEQUENCE>10
<FILENAME>p14077exv10w78.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.78
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w78</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.78</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><B>FORM OF ANNUAL GRANT AGREEMENT</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">US AIRWAYS GROUP, INC.<BR>
2008 EQUITY INCENTIVE PLAN<BR>
DIRECTOR VESTED SHARE AWARD AGREEMENT

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the Director Vested Share Award Grant Notice (&#147;<I>Grant Notice</I>&#148;) and this Director
Vested Share Award Agreement (&#147;<I>Award Agreement</I>&#148;), US Airways Group, Inc. (the &#147;<I>Company</I>&#148;) grants you
a Vested Share Award under its 2008 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;<I>Plan</I>&#148;) for the number of vested
shares of Company Stock (&#147;<I>Vested Shares</I>&#148;) as indicated in the Grant Notice (collectively, the
"<I>Award</I>&#148;). Terms not defined in this Award Agreement but defined in the Plan have the same
definitions as in the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The details of your Award are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;NUMBER OF VESTED SHARES OF COMPANY STOCK. The number of Vested Shares subject to your
Award is stated in the Grant Notice. Each Vested Share represents one (1)&nbsp;share of Company Stock.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;VESTING. The Vested Shares are fully vested on the Date of Grant as provided in your
Grant Notice,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;PAYMENT. This Award was granted in consideration of your services to the Company. You
will not be required to make any payment to the Company (other than your past and future services
with the Company) with respect to your receipt of the Award or the delivery of the shares of
Company Stock.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;DELIVERY OF SHARES. The Company will deliver to a broker designated by the Company on
your behalf, a number of shares of Company Stock equal to the number of Vested Shares subject to
your Award. The Company shall determine the form of delivery of the shares of Company Stock
subject to your Award.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;SECURITIES LAW COMPLIANCE. Your Award is subject to the provisions of Section&nbsp;17 of the
Plan on continuing securities law compliance.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;TRANSFER RESTRICTIONS. Before the shares of Company Stock subject to your Award have been
delivered to you, you may not transfer, pledge, sell, or otherwise dispose of the shares. This
restriction on transfer will lapse upon delivery to you of shares of Company Stock in respect of
your Vested Shares. Your Award is not transferable, except by will or by the laws of descent and
distribution.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7. AWARD NOT A SERVICE CONTRACT. Your Award is not a service contract, and nothing in your
Award shall be deemed to create in any way whatsoever any obligation on your part to continue in
the service of the Company or any Related
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Company, or on the part of the Company or any Related Company to continue your service. Nothing in
your Award shall obligate the Company or its stockholders to continue any relationship that you
have as an Outside Director of the Company.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;NOTICES. Any notices provided for in your Award or the Plan shall be given in the manner
designated by the Company and shall be deemed effectively given upon receipt or, in the case of
notices delivered by the Company to you, five (5)&nbsp;days after deposit in the United States mail,
postage prepaid, addressed to you at the last address you provided to the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;MISCELLANEOUS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The Company&#146;s rights and obligations with respect to your Award shall be transferable by
the Company to any one or more persons or entities, and all of your covenants and agreements shall
inure to the benefit of, and be enforceable by the Company&#146;s successors and assigns.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;You agree upon request to execute any further documents or instruments necessary or
desirable in the Company&#146;s sole determination to carry out the purposes or intent of your Award.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;You acknowledge and agree that you have reviewed your Award in its entirety, have had an
opportunity to obtain the advice of counsel prior to accepting your Award, and fully understand all
provisions of your Award.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;This Agreement will be subject to all applicable laws, rules, and regulations, and to any
required governmental agency or national securities exchange approvals.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;The Company&#146;s obligations under the Plan will be binding on any successor to the Company,
whether the existence of the successor is the result of a direct or indirect purchase, merger,
consolidation, or otherwise, of all or substantially all of the Company&#146;s business and/or assets.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;HEADINGS. This Agreement&#146;s Section headings are for convenience only and shall not
constitute a part of this Agreement or affect this Agreement&#146;s meaning.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;SEVERABILITY. If all or any part of this Agreement or the Plan is declared by any court
or governmental authority to be unlawful or invalid, then that shall not invalidate any portion of
this Agreement or the Plan not declared to be unlawful or invalid. Any Section of this Agreement
(or part of such a Section) declared to be unlawful or invalid shall, if possible, be construed in
a manner that will give effect to the terms of the Section or part of a Section to the fullest
extent possible while remaining lawful and valid.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;GOVERNING PLAN DOCUMENT. Your Award is subject to all the provisions of the Plan, the
provisions of which are made a part of your Award, and is further subject to all interpretations,
amendments, rules and regulations which may be promulgated and adopted under the Plan. If there is
a conflict between the provisions of your Award and those of the Plan, then the provisions of the
Plan shall control.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>




</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.84</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><IMG src="p14077p1407700.gif" alt="(U.S AIRWAYS LOGO)">
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><B>U S AIRWAYS GROUP, INC.<BR>
2008 Long Term Incentive Program<BR>
(Established Effective March&nbsp;28, 2008)</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;I. Purpose</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">The purpose of the US Airways Group, Inc. 2008 Long Term Incentive Program (the &#147;Program&#148;) is to
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><I>Focus management efforts on the creation of long-term stockholder value.</I></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><I>Encourage strategic decision-making by providing rewards for the long-term achievement of
Company goals.</I></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">The Program sets forth the terms and conditions for performance cash awards to be paid to eligible
officers under the US Airways Group, Inc. 2005 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;II. Eligibility Criteria</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Officers of US Airways Group, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) or an Affiliate (as that term is defined in the
Plan) whose responsibilities have a direct and significant impact on Company results are eligible
to participate in the Program. The Compensation and Human Resources Committee of the Board of
Directors of the Company (the &#147;Committee&#148;) will, at its sole discretion, select individual officers
to participate in the Program (each a &#147;Participant&#148;). Participation in one performance cycle (as
such term is defined in Section&nbsp;IV) under the Program does not assure participation in any other
performance cycle.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">A person who is hired by the Company (or an Affiliate) as an eligible officer or promoted to
eligible officer status, in either case after the commencement of a performance cycle (as such term
is defined in Section&nbsp;IV) shall participate in performance cycles on such basis, if any, as the
Committee may provide.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;III. Award Levels</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Participants have the opportunity to earn cash awards under the Program based on the achievement of
long-term Company performance and, with certain exceptions set forth in Section&nbsp;V, continued active
employment by the Company (or an Affiliate) in an eligible position through the date of payment of
the cash awards. Threshold, target, and maximum award levels are set forth below. All award
levels are expressed as a percentage of a Participant&#146;s base salary, as in effect on the date of
payment of the cash award.
</DIV>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->Page 1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Award Levels Expressed as </B></FONT><BR>
<FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Percentages of Base Salary</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="21%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="center" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Officer Level</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Threshold</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Target</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Maximum</B></TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD align="center" valign="top">CEO

</TD>

</TD>

    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">200%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align="center" valign="top">President

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">49%
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">115%
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">200%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD align="center" valign="top">EVP
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">43%
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">100%
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">175%</TD>
</TR>

    <TD align="center" valign="top">SVP

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;70%
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">140%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD align="center" valign="top">VP
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">20%
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;45%
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;90%</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Performance below the threshold level for any performance cycle (as such term is defined in Section
IV) will result in no cash award. The maximum award for any performance cycle is two times the
target award, subject to further limitations contained in the Plan.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;IV. Award Calculation</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Awards are calculated based on Total Stockholder Return (&#147;TSR&#148;) of the Company over the performance
cycle (as such term is defined in this section) relative to the TSRs of a pre-defined competitive
peer group. TSR, for purposes of this Program, is the rate of return, including both the price
appreciation of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock or a competitive peer company&#146;s common stock and
the reinvestment of any dividends declared on such common stock, over the relevant performance
cycle. In order to smooth out market fluctuations, the average daily closing price (adjusted for
splits and dividends) for the common stock of the Company and of the companies in the pre-defined
competitive peer group for the three months prior to the first and last days of the performance
cycle will be used to determine TSR. Daily closing price of a share of common stock is the stock
price at the close of trading (4:00 p.m. Eastern Time) of the national exchange (New York Stock
Exchange, the Nasdaq Stock Market or the American Stock Exchange) on which such stock is traded.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>A)</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Performance Cycles</B></U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A performance cycle, over which TSR is measured, is the three-year period beginning January
1 of a given year and ending December&nbsp;31 of the second following year (each a &#147;Performance
Cycle&#148;). The Committee, in its sole discretion, may authorize Performance Cycles, and it is
anticipated, although not assured, that a three-year Performance Cycle will begin each
January 1.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All officers of the Company (or an Affiliate) otherwise eligible to participate in the
Program will be eligible to participate in a Performance Cycle commencing January&nbsp;1, 2008,
and ending December&nbsp;31, 2010.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>B)</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Peer Group and Award Payout Percentages</B></U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The competitive peer group consists of the following eleven companies: AirTran Holdings,
Inc., Alaska Air Group, Inc., AMR Corporation, Continental Airlines, Inc., Delta Air Lines,
Inc., Frontier Airlines Holdings, Inc., Hawaiian Holdings, Inc., JetBlue Airways
Corporation, Northwest Airlines Corporation, Southwest Airlines Co. and UAL Corporation.
Such competitive peer group is subject to modification, in the Committee&#146;s</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->Page 2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #textcolor#; background: #bgcolor#">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>sole discretion, to take account of unforeseen events such as mergers, dispositions,
bankruptcies and other significant business changes.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Award payout percentages will be based on the TSR of the Company relative to the TSRs of
competitive peer group companies, as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">

</TR>

</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">9-12 of 12</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;V. Award Payment Timing, Early Payment and Termination</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">If the TSR of the Company is at or above the threshold for a Performance Cycle, awards will be paid
in cash within sixty (60)&nbsp;days following the end of the Performance Cycle. For example, awards for
the Performance Cycle that runs from January&nbsp;1, 2008, through December&nbsp;31, 2010 will be paid no
later than March&nbsp;1, 2011. Payments will be subject to all required federal, state, and local tax
withholding.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">In the event of the termination of a Participant&#146;s employment with the Company (or an Affiliate) on
account of retirement (as defined below), total disability (as defined in the long term disability
plan under which the Participant is covered) or death, (i)&nbsp;the Company shall pay to the Participant
(or the Participant&#146;s estate in the case of death), at the same time as awards, if any, are paid to
other Participants for the same Performance Cycle, the award that the Participant would have earned
and received with respect to the Performance Cycle, if any, that ends with the calendar year in
which such termination occurs, had the Participant&#146;s employment continued until the award payment
date for such Performance Cycle. For purposes of the foregoing,
</DIV>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->Page 3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">&#147;retirement&#148; shall mean the termination of the Participant&#146;s employment with the Company (or an
Affiliate) after attainment of age <BR>
fifty-five (55)&nbsp;and completion of ten (10)&nbsp;years of service with
the Company (or an Affiliate). Awards for any other Performance Cycles will not be earned or paid.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">If the Participant&#146;s employment with the Company (or an Affiliate) is terminated for any reason
other than retirement, total disability or death (whether such termination is voluntary or
involuntary), no awards will be earned or paid under the Program with respect to any Performance
Cycles.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;VI. Program Administration</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">The Program will be administered by the Committee in accordance with the Plan and in a manner that
satisfies the requirements of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code for qualified
&#147;performance-based&#148; compensation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Awards generally are calculated and distributed as provided in Sections&nbsp;IV and V; <I>provided,
however, </I>that no award payments will be made unless the Committee certifies in writing (a)&nbsp;the
relative TSR ranking of the Company, (b)&nbsp;that all other material terms of the Program have been
satisfied and (c)&nbsp;that payments to Participants in stated amounts are appropriate under the
Program.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;VII. Absence of Program Funding; No Equity Interest</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Benefits under the Program shall be paid from the general funds of the Company, and a Participant
(or the Participant&#146;s estate in the event of death) shall be no more than an unsecured general
creditor of the Company with no special or prior right to any assets of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Nothing contained in the Program shall be deemed to give any Participant any equity or other
interest in the assets, business or affairs of the Company or any related company. It is not
intended that a Participant&#146;s interest in the Program shall constitute a security or equity
interest within the meaning of any state or federal securities laws.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;VIII. No Transferability</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">A Participant shall not have any right to transfer, sell, alienate, assign, pledge, mortgage,
collateralize or otherwise encumber any of the payments provided by this Program.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;IX. No Employment Rights</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">This Program is not intended to be a contract of employment. Both the Participant and the Company
have the right to end their employment relationship with or without cause or notice.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;X. Interpretation, Amendment and Termination</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">The Committee shall have the power to interpret all provisions of the Program, which
interpretations shall be final and binding on all persons. The provisions of this document shall
</DIV>
<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->Page 4<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">supersede all provisions of any and all such prior documents relating to the Program and its
subject matter. However, if the provisions of this document conflict with any provision of the
Plan, the provisions set forth in the Plan shall govern in all cases. The laws of the State of
Delaware shall govern all questions concerning the construction, validity and interpretation of the
Program, without regard to such state&#146;s conflict of laws rules.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">The Committee reserves the right to amend or terminate the Program at any time, with or without
prior notice; <I>provided, however, </I>that all amendments to the Program shall preserve the
qualification of awards under the Program as &#147;performance-based&#148; compensation under Section 162(m)
of the Internal Revenue Code. Notwithstanding the foregoing, (a)&nbsp;except as provided in Section&nbsp;IV
with respect to the calculation of TSR and in the following clause (b), the Committee may not amend
the Program in a way that would materially impair the rights of a Participant with respect to a
Performance Cycle that already has begun at the time of such amendment, unless such Participant has
consented in writing to such amendment; and (b)&nbsp;in the event of any act of God, war, natural
disaster, aircraft grounding, revocation of operating certificate, terrorism, strike, lockout,
labor dispute, work stoppage, fire, epidemic or quarantine restriction, act of government, critical
materials shortage, or any other act beyond the control of the Company, whether similar or
dissimilar (each a &#147;Force Majeure Event&#148;), which Force Majeure Event affects the Company or its
subsidiaries or other affiliates, the Committee, in its sole discretion, may (i)&nbsp;terminate or (ii)
suspend, delay, defer (for such period of time as the Committee may deem necessary), or substitute
any awards due currently or in the future under the Program, including, but not limited to, any
awards that have accrued to the benefit of Participants but have not yet been paid.
</DIV>



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->Page 5<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>




</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.88
<SEQUENCE>12
<FILENAME>p14077exv10w88.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.88
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w88</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.88</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><B>SUMMARY OF DIRECTOR COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Non-employee directors of US Airways Group, Inc. (&#147;US Airways Group&#148;) and US Airways, Inc. (&#147;US
Airways&#148;) currently receive the following compensation for their Board service:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Annual Retainer: $20,000<BR>
Annual Committee Chair Retainer (other than Audit): $4,000<BR>
Audit Committee Chair Retainer: $10,000<BR>
Attendance Fees: $1,000 for each Board or committee meeting attended

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U>2008 Equity Incentive Plan Grants</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">In accordance with the terms of the 2008 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;2008 Plan&#148;) and subject to the
discretion of the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;), each incumbent non-employee director will
receive, following each annual meeting of stockholders, an annual equity award of fully vested
shares of common stock, with such vested shares having an aggregate Fair Market Value (as defined
in the 2008 Plan) on the date of grant equal to $60,000, rounded down to the next whole number of
shares.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U>Travel Benefits</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Non-employee directors and their immediate family members, including dependent children under the
age of 19 (or under the age of 24 for children who are unmarried, dependent full-time students) but
not including parents, as well as a limited number of non-eligible family members and unrelated
persons, are provided free transportation on US Airways and US Airways Express, along with
reimbursement for federal and state income taxes in connection with that travel.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U>Expense Reimbursement</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Non-employee directors will also be reimbursed for all reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred
in connection with attendance at meetings upon submission of receipts.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U>Stock Ownership Guidelines</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">Effective as of June&nbsp;11, 2008, each incumbent non-employee director is required to retain, until
his or her completion of service on the Board, a number of shares equal to at least 50% of the
cumulative shares of common stock granted to that director pursuant each annual equity award
granted in the three years following the effective date of these guidelines. For each non-employee
director who joins the Board on or after the effective date of these guidelines, he or she is
required to retain, until his or her completion of service on the Board, a number of shares equal
to at least 50% of the cumulative shares of common stock granted to that director pursuant each
annual equity award granted in each of his or her first three years on the Board.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>




</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, THAT I, Herbert M. Baum, Director of US Airways Group, Inc.
(the &#147;Company&#148;) and US Airways, Inc. (&#147;Airways&#148;), do hereby appoint Derek J. Kerr and J. Scott
Kirby, and each of them (with full power to each of them to act alone), attorney and agent for me
and in my name and on my behalf to sign any Annual Report on Form 10-K of the Company and Airways
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 and any amendments or supplements thereto which shall be filed
with the Securities and Exchange Commission under the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as
amended.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I hereby give and grant to said attorneys and agents, and each of them, full power and
authority generally to do and perform all acts and things necessary to be done in the premises as
fully and effectually in all respects as I could do if personally present; and I hereby ratify and
confirm all that said attorneys and agents, and each of them, shall do or cause to be done by
virtue hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand this 16<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> day of February, 2009.
</DIV>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>16
<FILENAME>p14077exv31w1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-31.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv31w1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;31.1</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><U><B>CEO CERTIFICATION</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">I, W. Douglas Parker, certify that:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of US Airways Group, Inc.;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact
or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period
covered by this report;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and
maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and
15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure
controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made
known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this
report is being prepared;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal
control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial
statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting
principles;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures
and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure
controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such
evaluation; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the
registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control
over financial reporting; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent
evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit
committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of
internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect
the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who
have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Date: February&nbsp;17, 2009
</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="35%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

    <TD valign="top" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR>
    <TD align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000" align="left">/s/ W. Douglas Parker
&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR>
    <TD align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top">Name:&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="2" align="left">W. Douglas Parker&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top">Title:&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="2" align="left">Chief Executive Officer&nbsp;</TD>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.2
<SEQUENCE>17
<FILENAME>p14077exv31w2.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-31.2
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv31w2</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="48%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="35%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;31.2</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><U><B>CFO CERTIFICATION</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">I, Derek J. Kerr, certify that:
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of US Airways Group, Inc.;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact
or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period
covered by this report;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and
maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and
15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure
controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made
known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this
report is being prepared;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal
control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial
statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting
principles;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures
and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure
controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such
evaluation; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the
registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control
over financial reporting; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent
evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit
committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of
internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect
the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who
have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Date: February&nbsp;17, 2009
</DIV>


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD valign="top">Name:&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;31.3</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><U><B>CEO CERTIFICATION</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">I, W. Douglas Parker, certify that:
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of US Airways, Inc.;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact
or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period
covered by this report;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and
maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and
15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure
controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made
known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this
report is being prepared;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal
control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial
statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting
principles;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures
and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure
controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such
evaluation; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the
registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control
over financial reporting; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent
evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit
committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of
internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect
the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who
have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Date: February&nbsp;17, 2009
</DIV>
